title: Benefits of Extending the Grazing Season

tasks.task: Explain and address the misconception about cows needing legs to get their own food
subtasks: Clarify the misunderstanding where visitors confuse balers with cows having no legs
Acknowledge the intended message that cattle can graze on their own, implying they don't need legs to access food
Address the economic benefits of having cattle on pasture instead of in feedlots, including cost savings

tasks.task: Discuss environmental and nutrient management practices in agriculture
subtasks: Explain the importance of nutrient cycling from manure back to the soil
Highlight the issue with nitrogen not returning to the soil and the role of baling hay for winter feed
Mention the goal of reducing dependence on fossil fuels in agricultural practices
